cluster_relations.rel_desc: Beauty recognizes the Beast’s deeper qualities beyond his beastly outward form.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: Beast (cursed prince in "Beauty and the Beast")
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Beauty and the Beast Characters and Motifs

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: MoralDimension: judging character rather than appearance

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Beauty discovers the true inner nature of the prince.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Beauty and the Beast Characters and Motifs

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: after looking beyond his beastly exterior
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: NarrativeOutcome: moral recognition of inner character

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject comes to see or acknowledge the object's true inner nature or qualities, often in contrast to misleading outward appearances.
args.justification: Both relations describe Beauty coming to understand the prince/Beast's deeper, inner character beyond his outward beastly appearance. One emphasizes perception beyond surface, the other emphasizes discovery of true nature; these are two phrasings of the same cognitive act of recognizing true nature.

Both relations involve a mental act (perceiving, discovering, recognizing) by Beauty regarding the inner nature of another entity, fitting a shared class for cognitive/perceptual recognition of qualities or identity.
The core semantic dimension is cognitive: mental recognition and understanding of true nature beyond appearances, rather than physical, spatial, or causal interaction.
